Posts.Content: Hi , hang in there its my best guess that the lupron will brig you down to low numbers. I would have thought he would have tried that before chemo though. Keep up the fight! Thomas
Posts.Title: Stage 4 Roller Coaster

Posts.Content: Ok got it, i must hsve missed it
Posts.Title: Stage 4 Roller Coaster

Posts.Content: Hi, I also had 39 treatments about 7 years ago. The most i remember is having to pee every 15 minutes literally. I guess i could have called it a burn it was an intense urge and then couldn't get much out each time. Fitting because how much i went through the day. The doc prescribed ambian for the bad nites so i could stay asleep longer. Towards the end i got really bad gas and diarrhea. I was pretty wore out by the last few weeks because i work weekends so i was running 7 days aweek. All in all it was tolerable compared to what i thought it it would be. But we all respond differently to any treatment so it could be different for you. The lupron kicked my butt way more than radiation and still dose today 7 years later. The best of luck with remainder of your treatments. Thomas
Posts.Title: starting to feel the burn

Posts.Content: Hi, My dotor prescribed magace also known as megestrol. I had terrible hot flashes day and night. I still take it today. Stops hot flashes immediately.
Posts.Title: Hot flash treatments

Posts.Content: Zencat, i do remember when i first got the phone call from the doctors office. The nurse said the doctor wants to discuss my blood test. The appointment was for 3 days later. You can probably imagine what was going through my mind for those 3 days. When i did get to see the doc he told me my psa was 44 and he did an DRE and felt the tumor. They referred my to a urologists which was another weeks wait. By now even though i have no idea at that time how bad it is, i kind of settled in to a feeling of less fear and more of an optimistic as the urologist told me this can me managed, not cured but managed for many years. Nobody can really know the feeling of hearing the words you have cancer. You are no different from the rest of us we all went through it just like yoh are now. One thing you have going for you it is most likely contained within the postate and you can get rid of it. If for any reason it may return you can then go with radiation salvage. So you are in a good place as far as pca goes. It wont be ling before you will become a seasoned vet of the prostate cancer batlle. Hope all goes well, jeep us updated! Thomas

Posts.Title: First Post, Struggling to Stay Positive

Posts.Content: Hi Kittrcat, I am sorry to hear what your father is going through. Im sure this has rocked his world as well as yours. Pretty scary looking at his timeline im not far behind. I was diagnosed in 2011. The main thing i want to tell you you is dont forget about yourself in all this. I can tell your a natural caregiver being the history of your relationship with your dad. I have friend i dated in high school that was abused terribly by her father. He is in his 80's now and living with her due to his health. She is taking care of him waiting on him daily. Such strong people you are. Both of you. Only a woman has the strenth to forgive like that, Special ones at that. This cancer effects us that have it, and the ones that are close to us. It's a long journey for sure. Please do not forget about yourself in all this and unfortunatly hospice may be the best thing for you and him in the near future. Best of luck and god bless! Thomas

Posts.Title: Man cured of prostate cancer after being given testosterone to shock tumors

Posts.Content: Hi pretzel, I have been on lupron for almost 5 years. The side effects really hit me hard right from the get go. Moody, hot flashes every 20 minutes and sex for the first year i couldnt even think about. I also have heard that the majority of the side effects are from the absence of testosterone. The bone issue and weight gain and muscle loss im not sure. Thats a good question for the docs. I am lately experiencing increased loss of energy and forgetfulness and just feeling weird. Im sure its not good to be on any drug for this long. To finish i never thought of surgical castration till recently. Im mostly thinking on my bones and weight gain and possible increased chance of senility down the road. Maybe others know more about HDT here then me, i just know it kinda sucks but better than the other result. Keep us posted! Thomas
Posts.Title: Is it better to select medical castration vs. long term chemical castration

Posts.Title: Is it better to select medical castration vs. long term chemical castration

Posts.Content: Hi Robert, I rely dont think tbe procedure cod vause him problems. But the side effects from it could be getting to him. Incontnance and impotence are tough to deal with plus just having the cancer itself is hard to grasp early on for sure. I have had big changes in myself from hormone therapy and have been on it for seven years. The side effects of mood swings, depression and ED. Still gets to me. Its kind of like the new normal we have to live with. You would think after 7 years i would be an old hand at this stuff but in october i had a psa spike which in january ill have another psa done and scans. if it rises again their talking chemo. Actually this second time around is is no easier than the first. This crap aint easy. Thomas
Posts.Title: prostate personality change

Posts.Content: Thanks MM i do know ill be around for a long while. I know casodex should be a breeze. Ill keep everyone posted on upcoming results. Thanks a bunch! Thomas
Posts.Title: Cruising through ...till now

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone for the replies. MM i think my urologist wanted to see 3 straight rises before going ahead with CAB Febuary is close so ill hang in there to see what happens. Im sure casodex will be next.

Posts.Title: One Year and One day Later!

Posts.Content: Hello gacabrini, Do not give up on your bf ignoring or putting of getting this looked at. It's uncomfortable for sure to even think about getting a biopsy, and all the other stuff done. Heck, even a digital rectal exam can scare the hell out of a guy that has never been to the doctors much. That was me 5 years ago. I swear he can make it through all of the embarrassing stuff...i did. To get this taken care of before there is any chance if it is PC, to spread beyond the postrate is very important as it can give you and your bf more options in treatment. I pray its not cancer, good luck and keep us posted.

Posts.Title: Is it better to select medical castration vs. long term chemical castration

Posts.Content: I suppose i was to smug with my condition the past 4 years. The only thing i cared about was the terrible side effects the Lupron had on me and when i could stop them. I did elect to skip an injection to see if i could return to my old self. Well, going through puberty again was just about as bad having zero T. It did get better at the six month visit to the urologist. I felt good then, and planned on not getting another injection but my Psa jumped to 4. Of course i back on the lupron. The next visit Psa back down to 0.1. The next two 6 month visits 0.9. The following visit 6 months later is 2.9. In Febuary 2017 will see what goes and probably have some bone scans then. I had never been on any fourms before and like i said before very nonchalant about my PCa. I think this will change next visit not sure. Thanks for all on this fourm as i am learning more about my PCa. Thomas
Posts.Signature: Age 58 November 2011 Dx PCa Psa- 44 stage- 4 Gleason-8 Cancer outside of posttate December - Lupron 6 month injections May 2012 - Psa 0.0 45 radiation treatments fast forward- May 2014 Psa 0.1 Skipped Lupron Injection - For sanity November 2014 Psa 4 back on lupron May 2015 Psa 0.1 November 2015 Psa 0.9 May 2016 Psa 2.9

Posts.Content: Hi, I have had shortness of breath for the last 2 years of my lupon treatments. Of course my GP wznted to do the whole 9 yards with my heart. I talked her out of n it as i was thoroughly chrcked a few years ago. Still going to have my lungs checked because of years of working with asbestos before anyone knew of the dangers. After that i was always in dusty environments cleaning floors before installing tile. The joint compound is full of silica. How much is treatments or abuse from work i dont know. But seemed to have gotten worse within tbe last year.
Posts.Title: Metastistic secondary bone cancer

Posts.Content: Almost my diagnosis but my Gleason was 9 Psa 44. I had back pain and hip pain. Pca was outside of the prostate but not in the bones. His Gleason is very encoraging as others here will tell you. He has a great outlook for many years of living. I have been on lupron for about 5 years now. After MRI you will knowore of the best path to explore. Keep us updated. I feel he will do just fine. Thomas
